This incident highlights an ongoing transnational gang feud, following the recent murder of businessman Ramesh Rulania in Rajasthan, also suspected to be linked to Godara's gang.

title: Midnight rescue: Mumbai Police saves newborn abandoned in Goregaon
description: Mumbai Police officers from Bangur Nagar Police Station rescued a newborn baby abandoned between two parked vans in Goregaon. Beat Marshals discovered the infant around midnight and immediately alerted the Nirbhaya Squad. The baby was rushed to Shatabdi Hospital, declared stable, and subsequently handed over to St. Catherine’s Home for care.

title: This is how FMCG firms will pass GST 2.0 benefits—It's not cutting prices!
description: Get ready for bigger biscuits and bottles! FMCG companies are bringing back popular price points like Rs 5 and Rs 20 by mid-November. Following GST rate cuts, companies will now offer increased product quantities instead of lower prices, ensuring a win-win for consumers and retailers. This move aims to simplify transactions and restore consumer satisfaction.

title: ChatGPT gets browser: Google loses $150B; Chrome faces monopoly threat
description: OpenAI's new AI browser, ChatGPT Atlas, has shaken the tech world.  The launch caused a massive $150 billion drop in Alphabet's market value.  CEO Sam Altman called it a rare chance to redefine web browsing.  Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly, allowing AI to perform tasks.  This poses a significant challenge to Google's search advertising revenue.  Investors are watching closely as Google also integrates AI into its Chrome browser.  The competition for browser dominance is heating up.

title: ‘Tragic irony’: Congress slams Lokpal for BMW tender, questions public spending
OpenAI responds to WhatsApp ban on ChatGPT, says 'thankfully we have ...'
description: ChatGPT will cease functioning on WhatsApp from January 15, 2026, due to Meta's updated API policies banning general-purpose AI chatbots. OpenAI urges users to link their accounts to their phone numbers before the deadline to preserve chat history, as conversations won't transfer automatically. Users can continue accessing ChatGPT via its dedicated app and website.

title: Electric shock car handles, wheels with pepper spray: Mexico gears up for World Cup
description: Mexican security firms are bolstering services for wealthy tourists during the 2026 FIFA World Cup, offering armoured vehicles and armed escorts amid concerns over cartel violence.  Companies are expanding fleets and protective gear, with daily rentals costing up to $1,100.  Despite cartel threats, some experts believe they may not disrupt the tournament.

title: Chopper scare: President Murmu’s helicopter wheels sink into landing pad in Kerala

Over the next four days, her agenda features a prominent pilgrimage to the revered Sabarimala temple, alongside several inaugural ceremonies and centenary festivities throughout the region.

description: A new Florida study shows that banning mobile phones in schools leads to higher test scores, fewer absences, and initial disciplinary challenges. Supporting research from England, Pakistan, and other US states confirms improved academic performance and reduced distractions. Tools like Yondr pouches have helped schools enforce bans effectively. With more US states adopting phone restrictions, evidence grows that limiting phone use during school hours benefits student focus and achievement.

Kohli boasts an impressive record at Adelaide Oval, while Rohit seeks to improve his modest statistics. Experts believe the duo will find their rhythm and contribute significantly to India's batting success.

title: ‘Festival of lights’: PM Modi thanks Trump for Diwali greetings
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi  on Wednesday thanked US President Donald Trump for his Diwali greetings and phone call, highlighting India and the US as "great democracies" united against terrorism. Trump also extended Diwali wishes, mentioning discussions on trade and the situation with Pakistan, despite recent US tariffs on Indian oil imports.

title: Not in your brain, top neurosurgeon explains how dementia can start ‘in your legs’
description: Early signs of dementia may not always manifest as memory loss but can appear as subtle changes in leg health and walking. Weak leg muscles, reduced walking speed, and altered gait can signal declining brain-body communication and circulation, potentially preceding cognitive issues. Monitoring these physical red flags offers an opportunity for early intervention and improved quality of life.

title: Amid deadlock over US’ ‘Russian oil’ & ‘Indo-Pak ceasefire’ claims comes Modi-Trump Diwali warmth

description: US President Donald Trump announced that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured him India will significantly reduce its oil purchases from Russia. Trump mentioned this during a White House Diwali event. He also indicated that both leaders are working on trade deals. A potential meeting between Trump and Modi is being considered for the upcoming ASEAN summit.

title: Midnight blaze in Navi Mumbai high-rise: How 10 residents survived
description: A devastating fire ripped through a Vashi high-rise, claiming four lives, including an elderly woman and a young family. The blaze, originating on the 10th floor of Raheja Residency, left ten others hospitalized for smoke inhalation. Authorities are investigating the cause, with Diwali lamps or a short circuit being potential factors. Firefighters battled the flames, while lower-floor residents evacuated safely.

title: US 'technical rule' angers China, escalates trade tensions
